SENT.plain: The patient was a 26-year-old male who was noted to have asymmetry on the face, upper limbs, and trunk, and who showed no pursuit eye movements and no changes in the facial expression from birth
The patient developed transient global amnesia and was hospitalized
Neurological examination established atrophy of the right face, and left trunk involving the upper limb, and bilateral oculomotor and abducens nerve palsy

In auditory brainstem response, waves III to V were bilaterally obscured, and the blink reflex disclosed disturbances of peripheral facial nerve and the brainstem, suggesting developmental abnormalities of the facial motor nucleus
Contralateral R1 was also recorded in the blink reflex, and crossed trigeminofacial pathway was suspected
Möbius syndrome is associated with various muscle and skeletal abnormalities, but the coexistence of crossed total hemiatrophy has not been reported
We think that our case might be the first case of Möbius syndrome with total hemiatrophy
